sense.name: physical exertion
sense.examples: Bob's doctor told him to get more exercise and to eat less. It was a lot of exercise to place the big stones into a wall. The horses require daily exercise around the track.

sense.name: the utilization or employment of something
sense.examples: The President's exercise of his veto power surprised the Congress. It was a useful exercise of diplomacy that averted a trade war. This incident has been a frustrating exercise in public relations.

sense.name: a repeated practice, a drill
sense.commentary: EXERCISE[+event][+practice][+skill][+drill] Note: implies physical practice or drill
sense.examples: The young pianist spends two hours a morning on agility exercises. The Russians are conducting naval exercises in the Caribbean.

sense.name: intellectual problems to solve, examples
sense.commentary: EXERCISE[+information][+example][+problem] Note: related to Sense 3 but implies intellectual problem_solving
sense.examples: The teacher told the class to complete the exercises at the end of Chapter Four. The math exercise was quite difficult and took John all weekend.

sense.name: a ceremony with processions
sense.examples: The college dean will attend graduation exercises. The army performed exercises for the public in the Fourth of July parade.
